description: a(n) = |{m : multiplicative order of 4 mod m=n}|.
comments: The multiplicative order of a mod m, GCD(a,m)=1, is the smallest natural number d for which a^d = 1 (mod m).a(n) is the number of orders of degree-n monic irreducible polynomials over GF(4).
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..160
formula: a(n) = Sum_{ d divides n } mu(n/d)*tau(4^d-1), (mu(n) = Moebius function A008683, tau(n) = number of divisors of n A000005).
maple: with(numtheory):a:= n-> add(mobius(n/d)*tau(4^d-1), d=divisors(n)):seq(a(n), n=1..60);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 12 2012
mathematica: a[n_] := DivisorSum[n, MoebiusMu[n/#]*DivisorSigma[0, 4^# - 1]&]; Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 11 2015 *)
crossrefs: Column k=4 of A212957. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 12 2012
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 06 2001
